output.conclusion: This course has provided a foundational understanding of physiotherapy principles and techniques. Further study and practical experience are essential for developing proficiency in this field.
output.introduction: Welcome to Physiotherapy Fundamentals! This course will provide an intermediate-level overview of the core concepts and principles that underpin physiotherapy practice. We will explore key areas such as anatomy, biomechanics, assessment techniques, and basic treatment modalities.

chapters.description: Overview of the physiotherapy profession, its scope of practice, and ethical considerations. Discuss the role of a physiotherapist in healthcare.
A brief history of physiotherapy and its evolution into modern practice. Key milestones and influential figures.
Review of essential anatomical terms, planes of motion, and directional terms. Understanding anatomical position.
Introduction to the skeletal system, including bone types, joint classifications, and key bony landmarks relevant to physiotherapy.
Overview of the three types of muscle tissue (skeletal, smooth, and cardiac) and their functions. Focus on skeletal muscle structure.
Explanation of muscle actions (e.g., flexion, extension, abduction) and how muscles work together to produce movement. Agonist, antagonist, and synergist muscles.
Introduction to biomechanical principles, including levers, forces, and motion. Application of these principles to human movement.
Overview of the gait cycle (stance and swing phases) and the biomechanical events that occur during each phase. Common gait deviations.
Introduction to the subjective assessment process, including history taking, patient interview techniques, and identifying red flags.
Overview of objective assessment techniques, such as observation, palpation, range of motion testing, and muscle strength testing.
Principles of therapeutic exercise, including range of motion exercises, strengthening exercises, and stretching techniques.
Overview of common physiotherapy modalities, such as heat, ice, ultrasound, and electrical stimulation. Indications and contraindications.
